name: Slop Cube
desc: A cube that is not perfect but always moving.

name: ðŸ‘€ bot
desc: Adds eyes to things.

name: Spinners
desc: The bot version of Spinners, which generates bunches of spinning things all the time.

name: Self-Tagging Bot
desc: Fun-loving bot that tags itself in pictures and encourages you to do the same!

name: Colorer
desc: Looks at pictures; tries to see where color boundaries are, then takes a shot at filling those boundaries in its own way.

name: Dem Bones
desc: A bot that tries to assemble skeletons at random

name: Land of Contrasts
desc: It makes those maps that tell you how each state in     the country feels about some topic. It may or may not skip the surveying part.

name: Hills
desc: It makes hills; sometimes a lot of them, sometimes a few of them. In different colors.

name: Autocomplete Jokes
desc: It knows how knock knock jokes go, but when it comes to filling them in, it needs help. So, it sees what Google's autocomplete suggests.

name: Fucking Shakespeare
desc: What if Shakespeare said "fuck" a lot?

name: GODTRIBUTES
desc: A bot that posts tributes to befitting each god! My most popular bot.

name: The Most Successful Bot I've Met
desc: A bot powered by ConceptNet and Wordnik telling you all about the most successful people it's met, so that you, too, can be successful, which is all we all want to be.

name: Autocomplete Rap
desc: Autocomplete-powered raps. (Retired.)

name: Bot in the Street
desc: A snowclone in the street but a meme in the sheets! Powered by <a href="https://wordnik.com">. (Retired.)

name: Demake Bot
desc: Bot that remakes images into lower-resolution images. (Retired.)

name: Hail Ants Bot
desc: News about the inevitable hegemony of ants, an ever-growing threat to humanity. (Retired.)

name: Improvebot
desc: Always taking concepts and improving them, bot-style. (Retired.)

name: Link Finding Things
desc: Doo doo doo doo! (Retired.)

name: Member Facts
desc: Getting you the real *facts* about who's in what band and what guys the shows are *about*! (Retired.)

name: Monster Subtypes
desc: Discovered new, very specific monster subtypes all the time! (Retired.)

name: Our Magick Future
desc: Strange things we don't understand are happening to our world! Catch up on them here. (Retired.)

name: Snake People Bot
desc: Are you alarmed about these new snake people? No? You should be! A bot that gathers news about their doings. A bot port of Eric Bailey's amazing Millennials to Snake People browser extension. (Retired.)

name: Space Weirdness Bot
desc: Floating through space, discovering unexpected things all over. (Retired.)
